item.description:

After nearly two decades, Seven has the upper hand in the ongoing footy show contest. What will Nine offer next year to come back from this?

item.description:
AFL Footy Show announces new format for 2019 - and Sam will be back!  The Roar

Channel 9's AFL Footy Show has changed its format, but it turns out Sam Newman won't be retiring after all.

The iconic AFL panel show will be knocked down and re-built from scratch to create an entirely new concept for 2019. Host Eddie McGuire made the ...

item.title: Nine to shake up AFL Footy Show plans in 2019 - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
Nine to shake up AFL Footy Show plans in 2019  mUmBRELLA*

Nine’s AFL Footy Show host, Eddie McGuire, has revealed a number of changes to the network’s AFL offering for 2019. McGuire, who announced the news on his radio show, Triple M Hot Breakfast, first hosted the program when it launched in 1994. McGuire announced he would no longer host the weekly AFL Footy Show He later took an 11 year hiatus from the program, before announcing his return in July last year. Today, McGuire said he will no longer host a weekly program, instead running a number of ‘specials’ alongside Sam Newman next year. “We are going to just change it up a bit next year,” McGu...

item.title: Why Sam turned down ‘I’m a Celebrity …’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Why Sam turned down ‘I’m a Celebrity …’  The Advertiser

He’s not going anywhere. But don’t expect him lobbing into the jungle with Ten either. The Footy Show scallywag known as “The Fossil” or “Foss” confirmed to The Herald Sun he had signed with Nine for at least two more years. INSIDERS: HOW THE FOOTY SHOW RATINGS TUMBLED BAD BLOW: FOOTY SHOW RATINGS CRASH TO ALL-TIME LOW MOVING ON: LONG-TIME MEMBER LEAVES FOOTY SHOW “I am very pleased to be continuing on with the network,” Newman said. “I’ll be there for the foreseeable future and I’m very pleased to be on board again. It’s business as usual.” Newman, 72, has agreed to a new multi-year exclus...

item.title: Eddie McGuire kicks off the new lookAFL Footy Show - The Advertiser
item.description:
Eddie McGuire kicks off the new lookAFL Footy Show  The Advertiser

Former AFL Footy Show host Eddie McGuire is back to front the new look show. Courtesy: Nine Network

item.title: Football fans to get more McGuire - The Australian
item.description:
Football fans to get more McGuire  The Australian

The Magpies are in the midst of a review regarding their business model, which includes ­examinations of their football and netball departments. Coach Nathan Buckley’s tenure is in peril, with the Magpies sitting 14th ahead tomorrow’s clash against West Coast at Etihad Stadium. But McGuire, who earlier this week defended his long-running presidency of Austra­lia’s biggest football club, will also be tasked with rescuing the flagging AFL show. He will replace Melbourne journalist Craig Hutchison, whose tenure co-hosting with Rebecca Maddern proved short-lived, with the show recently beaten i...

item.title: Eddie’s shock truths as Newman breaks silence - The Advertiser
item.description:
Eddie’s shock truths as Newman breaks silence  The Advertiser

It was revealed on Friday McGuire will co-host the program alongside Rebecca Maddern and Sam Newman, while Craig Hutchison has been axed. “The stars aligned literally in the last 24 hours,” McGuire said on ABC radio on Saturday. “There has been discussion over the last couple of months ... but ultimately I got the all clear on Thursday from Fox Footy. “Then yesterday all hell broke loose after Sam’s effort on Thursday night and from about 12.30-2.30 it was all systems go. “I didn’t have time to tell my wife until late in the afternoon.” While the move may have been finalised and announced h...

item.title: Chopper, Hi-5 and game shows top Nine’s 2017 programming slate - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
Chopper, Hi-5 and game shows top Nine’s 2017 programming slate  mUmBRELLA*

A new Underbelly series about Mark ‘Chopper’ Read, the return of kids’ show Hi-5 and a “bold” relationship experiment show are among the local highlights of Nine Entertainment Co’s TV programming for next year. Ben Mingay and Rachael Taylor star in House of Bond While the network had a horror start to 2016 allowing Seven to wrap up the ratings year in August, it has recovered in recent weeks thanks mainly to The Block, winning five ratings weeks in a row. New shows unveiled at the ‘Upfront & Personal’ event include Chopper, a return of the Underbelly series looking at the life of gangster M...

item.title: Sam’s most outrageous skit clangers - The Advertiser
item.description:
Sam’s most outrageous skit clangers  The Advertiser

Here are the Fossil’s worst skit clangers since the show has been on air. BLACKFACE FURORE When Nicky Winmar refused to appear on the show in 1999 — six years after his iconic photograph was taken — Newman decided to “step in” and appear on set in blackface, with his face covered in shoe polish. BARING (B)ALL No stranger to nudity, Newman was first dacked on air by Shane Crawford in 2001, revealing his genitalia in the revealing episode. His nether region and buttocks were revealed on air again during a skit featuring a bottomless Newman, who flashed audiences when he was being “helped” off...

item.title: Lyon: ‘I’ve got to live with it’ - The Australian
item.description:
Lyon: ‘I’ve got to live with it’  The Australian

Speaking to SEN radio host Mike Sheahan, the Melbourne Demons legend apologised for the affair with the ex-wife of Brownless, details of which emerged early last year and rocked the media and AFL worlds. Lyon also revealed that he is still in a relationship with Nicky Brownless. “It’s important I apologise publicly for the hurt they’ve been through,” he said in a prerecorded interview. “A lot of hurt has resulted from it (the affair) and I’ve got to live with that, I’ve got to carry that.” Lyon has returned to the media on SEN’s breakfast show with Hamish McLachlan and former AFL star Tim W...

item.title: Lyon shows he’s not ‘crying wolf’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Lyon shows he’s not ‘crying wolf’  The Advertiser

From Wayne Carey to Ben Cousins to Brendan Fevola, the AFL industry is littered with players afforded second chances to redeem themselves. GARRY LYON: It’s important I say this Some, like Cousins, fritter away that chance away. Media powerhouse and former Melbourne captain Garry Lyon did enough today to suggest he will take that opportunity with both hands. The famously private Lyon didn’t spill his guts in a SEN interview and reveal every tawdry detail of his rift with Billy Brownless after entering a relationship with wife Nikki behind his back. But his in-depth and hopefully cathartic ac...

item.title: House Rules wins the night but Masterchef tops demos - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
House Rules wins the night but Masterchef tops demos  mUmBRELLA*

Seven’s House Rules has topped the ratings leader board as the most-watched non-news program with 936,000 metro viewers. According to OzTAM’s overnight preliminary metro ratings, House Rules came second to Matserchef in key advertising demographics 16-39, 18-49 and 25-54. Fiona and Nicole, and Kat and Harry got into a heated disagreement on last night’s episode of House Rules Ten’s rival reality cooking show Masterchef pulled 845,000 metro viewers and topped the key advertising demographics. Meanwhile, also airing in the competitive 7.30pm timeslot, Nine’s Britain’s Got Talent saw 640,000 t...

item.title: Butterss: I had drugs when Saints president - The Advertiser
item.description:
Butterss: I had drugs when Saints president  The Advertiser

The former high-flying businessman revealed he made key decisions while affected by intoxicants, including around the time of the hiring and firing of AFL legend Malcolm Blight as coach in 2000-01. He told Channel Nine’s The Footy Show he had never seen cocaine until he joined St Kilda. “(AFL is) a party environment after dark, there’s a lot of drugs,” Butterss, 58, said. “A lot of drugs. A lot of alcohol, a lot of gambling.” CHRIS YARRAN: METH RUINED MY LIFE Butterss revealed he was an alcoholic and that after being forced out as Saints president following seven years at the top in 2007, h...

item.title: Host explodes: ‘Political whores’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Host explodes: ‘Political whores’  The Advertiser

Newman, who is never shy about letting his opinion be heard, claimed the AFL had “no right” to get involved in political messages and tell footy fans what to vote for. “Before I start this, I know it’s going to get hijacked (by) the predictable people who will say what it’s not,” he said. “But if this was about the AFL putting ‘yes’ on the football about climate change, or save the whales, or greenhouse emissions or whatever, I would have exactly the same opinion. The very fact it’s about the Yes vote for gay marriage is irrelevant, so please don’t hijack this into somethig it’s not. “But w...

item.title: ‘Dirty bogan’: Co-host exacts juicy revenge - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘Dirty bogan’: Co-host exacts juicy revenge  The Advertiser

We all know that guy in a group whose sole purpose is to be public enemy No. 1 and cop the brunt of everyone’s banter. For the crew at Channel Nine’s Sunday Footy Show, it’s easy to see who plays the role of chief victim. Journalist Tony Jones has copped a beating from his co-hosts all year, repeatedly being referred to as “Chompers” after appearing on the show with a fresh set of pearly whites following some serious dental work. Jones has been a constant target of live-TV ribbing after an awkward exchange with Nine’s Rebbeca Judd in 2016. Jones attempted to kiss his co-host goodbye as she ...

item.title: Eddie returns to The Footy Show - The Australian
item.description:
Eddie returns to The Footy Show  The Australian

McGuire, the president of the Collingwood Football Club and a former CEO of the Nine Network, got his big break in 1994 when he became host of the top-rating AFL talk show. He spent more than 10 years on the show, combining it with additional duties as host of Who Wants To Be A Millionaire before he replaced David Gyngell as the boss of Nine. The Herald Sun is reporting that journalist and presenter Craig Hutchison, who replaced James Brayshaw as host of The Footy Show, would step aside. However, it’s understood co-hosts Bec Maddern — who replaced Gary Lyon last year — and the ever-controve...

item.title: ’Don’t argue’: Dusty on ‘creepy’ Bruce - The Advertiser
item.description:
’Don’t argue’: Dusty on ‘creepy’ Bruce  The Advertiser

After surging to the top of the leaderboard, Martin was sitting at his table on Monday night when McAvaney snuck up behind him to ask some questions. RICHMOND TRAINING AND PARADE LIVE “He just popped up out of nowhere,” Martin explained on the Footy Show. “He gave me a bit of a fright. It was quite scary. “To be honest I didn’t know what was going on.” Footy Show host Eddie McGuire then suggested Martin could have used his trademark ‘don’t argue’ on McAvaney. Martin responded: “I probably would have if I was p****d.” The Martin interview was one of the highlights on a huge night of football...

item.title: Lockett more for the rookies - The Australian
item.description:
Lockett more for the rookies  The Australian

Franklin was snapped on Wednesday in his first training session with a trimmed-down Lockett, who has returned to his former club as a part-time specialist forwards coach. The pair conferred as 30-year-old Franklin geared up for tomorrow’s round-one match with Port Adelaide at the SCG. But Longmire expected Lockett to direct more of his expertise towards the club’s emerging forwards than those already established such as Franklin, Kurt Tippett and Sam Reid. “Really I don’t think he’s going to be working a whole heap with Lance,” Longmire said. “His focus is probably going to be a little bit ...

item.title: Sam blasts ‘disgraceful, psychotic anarchists’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Sam blasts ‘disgraceful, psychotic anarchists’  The Advertiser

The AFL legend and Channel Nine Footy Show panellist was referring to a photo Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull posted at an AFL game, and he gave some other thought-provoking answers in an interview with former Labor leader Mark Latham on his program Mark Latham’s Outsiders this week. In the chat Newman addressed matters such as the AFL’s involvement in the same sex marriage debate, political correctness, whether the Footy Show is racist, Eddie McGuire’s dramas and what’s wrong with America. ON AFL’S INVOLVEMENT IN THE SAME SEX MARRIAGE DEBATE When told a rainbow flag was flying next to a Sw...

item.title: Newman unloads: ‘This country is rooted’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Newman unloads: ‘This country is rooted’  The Advertiser

And this time, the controversial 71-year-old may have outdone himself. Newman made headlines in July after making an on-air statement in the direction of Channel Nine, sitting in silence before raising his middle finger to the camera. But this effort on Thursday night’s Footy Show was slightly more political, taking aim at the latest controversy surrounding Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull. The Liberal Party leader was taken to the cleaners after posting a photo of himself at the footy while holding his grandchild in one arm and a beer in the other. “Does anyone see anything irresponsible wi...

item.title: Sam Newman gives the finger on the Footy Show - The Australian
item.description:
Sam Newman gives the finger on the Footy Show  The Australian

Sam Newman stunned viewers and left his fellow Footy Show panelists baffled during a bizarre appearance on the long-running show on Thursday night. Courtesy: AFL Footy Show

item.title: Newman’s bizarre Footy Show protest - The Advertiser
item.description:
Newman’s bizarre Footy Show protest  The Advertiser

The TV veteran appeared to be attempting to send a message by refusing to engage in conversation or bring his usual colourful edge to the program. The trainwreck began from the opening moments of the show as Newman was introduced but sat down without barely saying a word. “Cat got your tongue tonight has it?” host Craig Hutchison immediately asked. “No, get on with it,” Newman replied. Comedian David Hughes started trying to engage the former Geelong star, who typically offers his opinion on the big football topics of the week. There hasn’t been a bigger story than the resignations of AFL f...

item.description:
Nine Program Schedule for Week Commencing March 26, 2017  mUmBRELLA*

Sunday March 26 7:00 Married at First Sight (final vowel reveal) 8:10 60 Minutes (ep 8 of season 39) 9:10 Lethal Weapon (ep 9 and 10 of 18 in season 1) 11:10 Outback Wrangler (repeat) 12:05 Murder in the First (ep 5 of 10 in season 3) 1:00 The Last Ship (repeat) (ep 11 of 13 in season 2) 2:00 Ground Floor (repeat) (ep 2 of 10 in season 2) Monday March 27 Sydney Brisbane 7:30 Married at First Sight (Aftermath Part 1) 8:40 House Husbands (ep 8 of 12 in season 5) 9:40 Botched (ep 7 of 10 in season 1) 10:40 Law & Order (repeat) (new to Nine) 11:40 Rizzoli & Isles (repeat) Melbourne Adelaide Per...

item.title: Live: Footy Show reels from debacle - The Advertiser
item.description:
Live: Footy Show reels from debacle  The Advertiser

Welcome to AFL Saturday, our coverage of today’s matches: Melbourne vs Fremantle Greater Western Sydney vs Port Adelaide Carlton vs Gold Coast Adelaide vs Essendon THE new-look Easter footy fixture has delivered a cracking Saturday of match-ups this year. The Demons are looking to show they are a legitimate finals contender this year when they face Fremantle at the MCG in the early game. GWS hosts the Power in a crunch clash in Canberra. Carlton and Gold Coast are both coming off big wins in round three and Adelaide could easily be premiership favourites if they can continue their good form...

item.title: Why Ralph Carr drives hard bargain - The Advertiser
item.description:
Why Ralph Carr drives hard bargain  The Advertiser

Five years after an out of contract Travis Cloke took Collingwood on a year-long will he-or-won’t he rollercoaster, Dustin Martin strapped Richmond onto the same ride. In both instances it was the biggest payday in the player’s career, yet in both instances the rival offers were bigger and better. FOOTY SHOW LIVE: WILL DUSTY REVEAL ALL? DONE DEAL: MARTIN TO STAY A TIGER, SPURN ROOS’ OFFER In both instances club legends begged for the restricted free agent to re-sign. And in both cases there was a bloke named Ralph Carr. Contract stand-offs for Carr are par for the course. This is not a crac...

item.title: The busiest player in the AFL - The Advertiser
item.description:
The busiest player in the AFL  The Advertiser

Richmond’s enigmatic champion is a study of contradictions, a 27-year-old with a million competing philosophies screaming to get out. A man in a hurry who wants to slow down and smell the roses. EXCLUSIVE: ROOS HUNT DUSTY, KELLY DOUBLE KIT OFF: WHEN SPORT STARS GET NUDE A deep thinker about religion and morals who still laughs it up at Footy Show agent provocateur Sam Newman on a weekly basis. A star footballer who wants an abiding legacy in AFL - but believes hanging around might get in the way of ambitious plans to overhaul Victorian education’s teaching methods. As he tells the Sunday He...

item.title: Eddie rejects Footy Show gay reveal rumour - The Advertiser
item.description:
Eddie rejects Footy Show gay reveal rumour  The Advertiser

McGuire is back hosting the program following Craig Hutchison’s sacking nearly three weeks ago and Thursday night will be his first appearance in the hot seat since his return was announced. McGuire has promised to bring plenty of changes to the show whose ratings have suffered in the face of fresh competition from Channel Seven’s AFL program The Front Bar. In response to what McGuire says is “internet rumour and innuendo”, he assured Australia the AFL’s first openly gay player would not be revealing themselves on the show this week. “I can tell you that is absolute nonsense. No, that’s not...

item.title: ‘It’s time we got rid of them’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘It’s time we got rid of them’  The Advertiser

Well, AFL Footy Show host Rebecca Maddern wants to do exactly that by getting rid of the banners the players crash through as they enter the arena each week. Maddern made the claim on the Channel Nine program, saying it was time the AFL did away with the dated routine. “Don’t you think it’s maybe time we don’t have the banners?” Maddern said. “No, hear me out. Everything in the game has become very professional and to start the game we run through a bit of crepe paper that costs $2.50. “It’s time we get rid of the banners.” Her claim was met with support in a surprising corner, as controver...

item.title: James is home on the ranges - The Advertiser
item.description:
James is home on the ranges  The Advertiser

The couple shared photos of their week-long road trip around the state on social media, with four of their children from previous relationships coming along for the ride. James, 50, who played cricket for South Australia and lived here for many years with ex-wife Sarah, couldn’t speak highly enough of the region as they stopped in at The Arkaroola Resort and Wilderness Sanctuary, hiked at Wilpena Pound and enjoyed the local hospitality at the Renmark and Cradock Hotels. “First hike done ... kids thought they were gonna perish Burke & Wills style!!! This place is really cool!!!,” he captione...

item.title: ‘In: Andy Lee. Out: Hughesy’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘In: Andy Lee. Out: Hughesy’  The Advertiser

The Melbourne comedian’s reduced role on the Footy Show tonight hasn’t saved him from the wrath of fans, who have, once again, taken to Twitter to call for his axing. Hughesy was a rare sighting tonight, with his only feature his segment ‘Back to the Twos’, where he gives out a few whacks to AFL personalities throughout the week. This week he whacked coaches Alastair Clarkson and John Longmire and social media reacted in kind. SAM’S WHACK FOR BOB: ‘GET OUT OF THE WAY, MATE’ DUSTY DECISION: THE $2.8M CALL MARTIN HAS TO MAKE MY ROOM: FOOTY SHOW TELETHON HELPS KIDS WITH CANCER RITA: MAKE THE F...

item.title: Copycats set to follow - The Australian
item.description:
Copycats set to follow  The Australian

Part of the deal with Martin and his manager Ralph Carr from the outset of negotiations was that they took “ownership” of the publicity of any final decision, and they sold it to the Nine Network’s Footy Show for a reported $50,000. After the news broke of the new seven-year contract, Richmond issued a brief press release claiming Martin would be their player for life. Gale said the arrangement, which had been in place since the pre-season when contract negotiations first started seriously, was far from ideal but was probably the way the business of football was heading. He said the Tigers ...

item.title: The Bachelor tops the demos, but NRL and news hand Nine a Thursday win - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
The Bachelor tops the demos, but NRL and news hand Nine a Thursday win  mUmBRELLA*

It was a successful night in entertainment for Ten, with The Bachelor topping the category, and dominating across all key advertising demographics – 16-39s, 18-49s and 25-54s – but it wasn’t enough to beat Nine in the average audience shares. The show, which pulled 764,000 metro viewers last Thursday, was up slightly this week as Ten had promised a dramatic night with three women departing the Bachelor Mansion. It attracted 787,000 metro viewers, with its largest portion of viewers coming from the 18-49 demographic. OzTAM’s overnight preliminary metro ratings indicated Ten was well ahead of...

item.title: Fans switch off from Footy Show - The Advertiser
item.description:
Fans switch off from Footy Show  The Advertiser

The Footy Show averaged 175,000 viewers — a huge drop from the 381,000 that tuned in for McGuire’s return on August 10. The Front Bar, with Andy Maher, Jonathan Brown and Sam Pang, averaged 190,000 viewers — a rise from its average over the past six weeks. The Front Bar peaked at 217,000 and The Footy Show at 176,000 in the hour — from 8.30pm to 9.30pm — that the two shows went head-to-head. Both shows were smashed in their first half-hour by the finale of The Bachelor Australia, which averaged over 300,000 viewers in Melbourne as Matty J chose Laura as his partner. SAM NEWMAN SLAMS AFL OVE...

item.title: Playboy saved Sam Newman’s life - The Advertiser
item.description:
Playboy saved Sam Newman’s life  The Advertiser

He’d been working for a transport company in the 1980s when a business partner asked him to guarantee a bank loan. The company went bust, Newman lost $400,000 and his house — and he was forced to start sleeping in the back of friend’s shop. As he tells Mark Howard in the latest episode of his podcast series The Howie Games, he was “stone, motherless broke”. “I’d played football and had a pretty good business and had a pretty good life then all of a sudden I had absolutely nothing,” Newman says. But a Playboy magazine changed everything. The former footy star — who retired in 1980 after play...

item.title: ‘It’s not back to the future’: Eddie McGuire returns for the ‘rebirth’ of Nine’s AFL Footy Show - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
‘It’s not back to the future’: Eddie McGuire returns for the ‘rebirth’ of Nine’s AFL Footy Show  mUmBRELLA*

Despite flicking the bird on air last night, Sam Newman will remain a host of Nine’s AFL Footy Show, and will be reunited with Eddie McGuire who returns to the show after an 11 year absence. McGuire will join Newman and co-host Rebecca Maddern, with Craig Hutchinson exiting after a four month stint as the once dominant show struggles against Seven’s competing Front Bar program. McGuire and Maddern addressed the media this afternoon. Commenting on his return, McGuire told the media in a live stream on 9news.com.au: “To come back with Bec, who’s dominating so much with Ninja at the moment, an...

item.title: Brayshaw opens up: ‘Just appalling’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Brayshaw opens up: ‘Just appalling’  The Advertiser

It was revealed earlier this month the former North Melbourne chairman parted ways with the network and would be replaced on the popular AFL program by host of The Sunday Footy Show Craig Hutchison. Reports surfaced initially suggesting the split was because contract negotiations broke down over money issues, but Brayshaw — who is divorced with four sons aged between nine and 22 — dismissed those rumours, saying instead the move was all about making improvements in his personal life. “I’ve got to get better at being a dad and a partner, being around a bit more, not being stressed and knacke...

item.title: Maddern part of Nine’s battle plan - The Advertiser
item.description:
Maddern part of Nine’s battle plan  The Advertiser

The journalist-turned-presenter, who won over viewers on the AFL Footy Show, will be announced today as host of the new action-packed sports competition Australian Ninja Warrior. “I’m very excited,” Maddern said of the gig. “It’s a brand new format and has a huge following overseas. It’s fresh, highly compelling and very entertaining — I know Australia will love it and I can’t wait for it to begin.” The concept fuses the worlds of athletics and entertaining, with competitors taking on an almost impossible obstacle course with brutal challenges. Its several international versions are huge hi...

item.title: Channel 7 to confirm worst kept secret - The Advertiser
item.description:
Channel 7 to confirm worst kept secret  The Advertiser

While the decision remains hush-hush within the walls of Seven, Taylor, 54, will partner veteran Bruce McAvaney on Channel Seven’s all-important Friday night call with Wayne Carey as the expert comments man. It will also see Taylor filling Cometti’s vacancy on Sunday afternoons, a timeslot in which he is expected to call with Hamish McLachlan. BAD BOYS: HIRD, LYON DOUBLE ACT ‘TOO RISKY’ FOR SEN McLachlan, 41, will remain host of Channel Seven’s popular Sunday morning Game Day program, despite discussing a possible release given his increased workload as a co-host of SEN breakfast with Garry...

item.title: Louie the Lip blazed a trail - The Advertiser
item.description:
Louie the Lip blazed a trail  The Advertiser

The Collingwood great loved a laugh and it was that sense of fun which turned him into a TV and media superstar. Whether he was calling matches, sitting on a football panel, or handing out Bertocchi hams, Richards found a way to captivate audiences. “Lou was a star on AM radio, FM radio, black and white as well as colour television and even film with The Club — such was his crossover appeal,” Eddie McGuire said. Richards’ newspaper columns for the Sun News-Pictorial quickly earned him the nickname “Louie the Lip”. He called the football alongside Ron Casey on radio’s 3DB and in 1959 joined ...

item.title: Ten’s Masterchef wins the demos but RBT and news help Nine win Thursday night - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
Ten’s Masterchef wins the demos but RBT and news help Nine win Thursday night  mUmBRELLA*

Ten’s Masterchef was able to maintain its position as the most-watched entertainment program of Thursday night, but Nine’s news offerings and a repeat episode of RBT handed the channel an audience share win over its competitors. Masterchef reached 895,000 metro viewers, slightly down from last week’s 917,000, and won across all key advertising demographics – 16-39s, 18-49s, 25-54s. Last night’s elimination episode saw the shock exit of Eliza. In the same time slot, Nine’s RBT reached 639,000 metro viewers and Seven’s Toddlers Make You Laugh Out Loud captured 542,000, according to OzTAM’s ov...

item.title: Sam off the leash in bizarre radio rants - The Advertiser
item.description:
Sam off the leash in bizarre radio rants  The Advertiser

Newman also takes swipe at former US president Barack Obama, praises current president Donald Trump and insists he’ll be sober for the return of the revamped format on Channel 9. Newman asked Triple M’s Hot Breakfast host Eddie McGuire — who is also returning to the show — whether Maddern will be there. “Is Rebecca still on the set or have we bounced back from her?” he asked. SNEAK PEEK AT WHAT’S PLANNED FOR NEW-LOOK FOOTY SHOW McGuire said: “We’ve got a spot for her in the carpark and we’ll cross to her.” As the interview wraps up a determined Newman revisits the topic, before McGuire assu...

item.title: Hutchy opens up on Eddie power play - The Advertiser
item.description:
Hutchy opens up on Eddie power play  The Advertiser

Welcome to AFL Saturday, our coverage of today’s matches: Essendon v North Melbourne, 1.45pm (AEST) Melbourne v Port Adelaide, 2.10pm Western Bulldogs v Gold Coast, 4.35pm Sydney v St Kilda, 7.25pm Fremantle v Hawthorn, 7.40pm SEX scandals, social media abuse and a huge shake-up of the Footy Show have dominated the week of AFL. Attention returned to the field as the Crows edged the Cats in a top-of-the-table clash on Friday night and there’s top eight implications involved in all five games on Saturday if you still believe Freo and Hawthorn are capable of making a run. Essendon is also in a...

item.title: Pops: ‘Someone’s car is getting egged’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Pops: ‘Someone’s car is getting egged’  The Advertiser

Every weekday we will be bringing you all the breaking footy news from across Australia as it happens. The big news today is The Footy Show’s return. We’ll have all the reax today from a big night in footy. TRIM EDDIE: HOW MCGUIRE LOST WEIGHT FOR FOOTY SHOW RETURN We will be providing rolling news as it happens and giving you all the latest insights from our experts around the country. Whoever you support, there is only one place to be.

item.title: Masterchef wins across the demos as Ten wins the audience share - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
Masterchef wins across the demos as Ten wins the audience share  mUmBRELLA*

Nine and Seven’s news offerings dominated the Thursday night TV ratings, but it was Channel Ten’s Masterchef which led the channel to win the audience share. According to OzTam’s preliminary overnight ratings, Channel Ten’s share of 19.8% was just ahead Nine’s 19.4% and Seven’s 16.7%. The ABC managed 9.9% and SBS had 5.2%. The two episodes of Channel Ten’s Masterchef were the most-watched shows across the key advertising demographics (16-39, 18-49, 25-54), as Masterchef’s 2016 winner, Elena Duggan, returned to the show. Masterchef’s 7:30pm episode collected 899,000 viewers, and the second e...

item.title: Mike Sheahan slams Sam Newman - The Advertiser
item.description:
Mike Sheahan slams Sam Newman  The Advertiser

The Footy Show star is nothing if not honest, and sometimes his blunt approach rubs people the wrong way. AFL journalist Mike Sheahan is the latest to take issue with the Geelong legend’s directness over a situation involving his son, Tony. The spat began when Newman interviewed underworld figure Mick Gatto for The Footy Show to get to the bottom of revelations Essendon approached him for help regarding the supplements saga. Gatto dropped a number of bombshells in the interview, including the revelation he has proof the Bombers did nothing wrong when it came to the legality of the drugs giv...

item.title: Eddie is fuming: ‘It is a total lie’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Eddie is fuming: ‘It is a total lie’  The Advertiser

That role is currently occupied by club legend Nathan Buckley, but after a number of underwhelming seasons, the former Collingwood captain remains under the blowtorch. The Collingwood job has been linked to several names, with Fremantle boss Ross Lyon tied to the position in recent days. But McGuire lost his cool when AFL Footy Show panellist Sam Newman, cheekily asked him to answer claims Lyon was firming for the job, and had held talks with the Footy Show host. “No I have not and it is a total lie,” McGuire told the AFL Footy Show. “There has been no discussion with any coach. I’ll say th...

item.title: The top 10 most-read sport stories of 2016 - The Advertiser
item.description:
The top 10 most-read sport stories of 2016  The Advertiser

The AFL grand final, drug scandals, player retirements and Garry Lyon dominated the online sporting agenda in 2016. Proving our thirst for Aussie rules knowledge, the story our readers clicked on more than any other in 2016 was a simple, but important one. In March, AFL boss Gillon McLachlan ensured the grand final would start at 2.30pm, quashing the idea of a twilight decider and keeping with tradition. “It was a long discussion and there is an appetite to look at a different start time in future, but on balance the prevailing view is tradition prevailed and it will start at 2.30pm this ye...

item.title: Rule-makers score an own goal - The Australian
item.description:
Rule-makers score an own goal  The Australian

It would need to be done in the dark. In secret. We can’t guarantee the safety of your rule fiddlers. Perhaps the swap could be facilitated under Kevin Bartlett’s statue at the MCG? Don’t know the stature of the Tiger legend? It is the one — the only one — covered in pigeon poo. Warning, though. No free kicks here. There will be names and there will be pack drills. No one who has bothered the game as much as your henchmen can claim anonymity. Hand them over — no rule books — and you get Sam and the crew. We reckon The Footy Show is tired and aimless. A once very popular show needs a face li...

item.title: ‘I felt a bit dirty listening to that’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘I felt a bit dirty listening to that’  The Advertiser

After more than a year away from the spotlight, the former AFL star-turned-media personality is back on the airwaves and on just his second day of work at SEN’s new breakfast radio program with Hamish McLachlan and Tim Watson, a tell-all interview aired where he discussed his battle with depression. Lyon took time out from his media commitments with Channel Nine as a Footy Show co-host and as a Triple M broadcaster, citing mental health reasons, following revelations in late 2015 he was in a relationship with the ex-wife of good friend and fellow Footy Show panellist Billy Brownless. In the...

item.title: 9Now set to live stream AFL and NRL Footy Show - mUmBRELLA*
item.description:
9Now set to live stream AFL and NRL Footy Show  mUmBRELLA*

9Now announces the live streaming of the AFL and and NRL Footy show throughout Australia. The announcement: 9NOW TO LIVE STREAM AFL AND NRL FOOTY SHOWS 9Now – Australia’s premier destination for live streaming and on-demand content – will stream both the NRL Footy Show and AFL Footy Show live and free across the country. 9Now has listened to Footy Show fans, and even if they don’t live in traditional footy states they can now enjoy live streaming of Australia’s favourite, Logie Award-winning sporting entertainment programs. Returning to its Thursday night spiritual home, The NRL Footy Show ...

item.title: Hutchy ‘understands’ Footy Show axe - The Advertiser
item.description:
Hutchy ‘understands’ Footy Show axe  The Advertiser

Hutchison exclusively told the Herald Sun he was disappointed about being axed from the Footy Show. “You can’t take life too seriously. You’ve got to have a go in life. Sometimes the easy thing to do is sit back and not have a go,” he told the Herald Sun. “Life goes on doesn’t it? It’s one of those things, I’ve got radio this morning so I’m back into it, we’ll be fine. “At the end of the day, the numbers weren’t good enough, I take full responsibility and accountability for that. Hutchison opened his radio show by reiterating his stance. “First of all, I totally understand and respect the d...

item.title: ‘The most humbling process in my life’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘The most humbling process in my life’  The Advertiser

Lyon has done an interview with Mike Sheahan that will broadcast in full tomorrow, saying he wanted to address the elephant in the room. SEN played part of the interview, which showed a very candid Lyon talking about his year dealing with mental health struggles. “What I can tell you, it has been the most humbling process in my life,” he told Mike Sheahan. “Because when you get to this stage in your life, when you lose control of your emotions, it just strips all ego from you, because you are in the hands, or your fall at the feet at whoever can help you. “You have this situation where you ...

item.title: Shades of LeBron but Dustin Martin's TV announcement not ideal for Richmond - The Guardian
item.description:
Shades of LeBron but Dustin Martin's TV announcement not ideal for Richmond  The Guardian

Richmond boss Brendon Gale concedes the television announcement of the multi-million dollar re-signing of AFL star Dustin Martin was far from ideal but flagged it as the way of the future. The Tigers missed the opportunity to release one of the biggest news stories in the AFL club’s history, having to hand control to Martin and his manager Ralph Carr, who sold it to Channel Nine’s Footy Show for a reported $50,000. Related: Collingwood coach Nathan Buckley 'rapt' after getting two-year contract extension There were shades of NBA star LeBron James, who announced his deal with Miami Heat via ...

item.title: Lyon opens up on Brownless saga - The Advertiser
item.description:
Lyon opens up on Brownless saga  The Advertiser

Lyon, the former Footy Show co-host, took time out from his media commitments with Channel Nine following revelations in late 2015 he was in a relationship with the ex-wife of good friend and fellow Footy Show panellist Billy Brownless. The pair fell out and Lyon took time away from the spotlight to deal with mental health issues. He’s now returned to work as part of SEN radio’s new breakfast program — alongside Tim Watson and Hamish McLachlan — and will be part of Nine’s Footy Classified program that starts later in the year. On Tuesday morning, Lyon revealed he was still in a relationship...

item.title: ‘I couldn't have coped’: Gaz’s empathy for Hird - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘I couldn't have coped’: Gaz’s empathy for Hird  The Advertiser

In a tell-all interview with Mike Sheahan, Lyon indicated he’d take a more “circumspect” approach to his radio and TV duties now that he understood what it was like to be under the media’s glare. “Oh yeah I do (empathise with James Hird),” Lyon told SEN Breakfast. “The pressures that come with being a topic of interest. I’m not on that level, but I couldn't have coped. “Thankfully no one knows where I live ... I wouldn’t have been able to handle that at all and I was part of the media that was involved with that.” Hird was admitted to hospital earlier this month, after a suspected drug over...

item.title: Eddie everywhere keeps it fresh - The Australian
item.description:
Eddie everywhere keeps it fresh  The Australian

The new/old host of Nine’s AFL Footy Show, host of Nine’s Millionaire Hot Seat, AFL commentator for Fox Footy, Triple M breakfast announcer, president of Collingwood, chairman of JAMTV and principal of McGuire Media (producer of Talking Footy on Seven) pauses before answering. As well he might. How do you respond when you have achieved everything and a reporter asks you “what’s the dream?”. “I am probably living the dream in many ways,” McGuire says, “the dream of a young boy without doubt.” He trails off before seizing on a thought: “For me I just love the challenge.” He gathers his though...

item.title: Eddie has work cut out to save Footy Show - The Advertiser
item.description:
Eddie has work cut out to save Footy Show  The Advertiser

Eddie McGuire is back but even the power of his charisma and personality may not be enough to save it. Featuring a new set and a couple of new segments, Thursday night’s show was “interesting”, but not interesting enough to prevent surfing across to Channel 7 to watch The Front Bar, which has been out-rating The Footy Show. Before its brief recess The Footy Show had continued to struggle with an identity crisis precipitated by an apparent need to operate within the constraints of political correctness, equal opportunity and common decency. Eddie McGuire kicks off the new look AFL Footy Show...

item.title: ‘I’m not a great dad’: Newman - The Advertiser
item.description:
‘I’m not a great dad’: Newman  The Advertiser

The thrice-married, thrice-divorced father of three is as refreshingly candid in describing the responsibilities and challenges of fatherhood as he is talking about his disenchantment with the game that made him a star. “I would probably say I’m not a great father, because I’m not traditional,” Newman confides. “I don’t show a hell of a lot of emotion, I try and show it in different ways like giving tangible things rather than being tacit about it. “But that’s the way you are, you can’t choose your parents unfortunately, my kids would say.” C-BOMB SAM DISMISSES EXPLETIVE PHONE RANT The word...
